page.title: 12RECREATION; COUNTRY PARK
page.content: {Thrybergh Country Park}is close to the {old village. }A lot of{water sports } can be done there; fishing, wind surfing, canoeing etc. with plenty of equipment for hire. The park has not been{open very long.}There are{paths } all the way round so people can{enjoy} the{landscape,}there are{picnic {areas,}a{car park}and a{cafe}for refreshments. Part of the park is a {nature reserve}and so the area is very good for{bird watching.} There are many{ducks}such as pintail, mallard and teal. Other{waterbirds}include coots, moorhens and grebes. In the surrounding area are many{woodland}and hedgerow birds: finches, tits, yellowhammers etc. There are also hawks, owls, gamebirds, skylarks, wagtails, woodpeckers plus many of the more common birds to be seen such as blackbirds, thrushes and magpies.
